author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...CENTER OF BERYL MAKES LANDFALL ON THE YUCATAN PENINSULA...
summary:
...CENTER OF BERYL MAKES LANDFALL ON THE YUCATAN PENINSULA...
 As of 6:05 AM EST Fri Jul 5
 the center of Beryl was located near 20.3, -87.4
 with movement WNW at 15 mph.
 The minimum central pressure was 975 mb
 with maximum sustained winds of about 110 mph.
